p: Root extracts significantly increased soil EC and pH, and significantly decreased SOC and TN ( Table 2). No significant effect was found for SWC and C/N ( Table 2). Soil pH increased with extract concentration increasing, and the highest pH and EC were at concentration of 10 mg·mL -1 and 5 mg·mL -1 with changes of 11.5% and 50.6%, respectively ( P < 0.05). SOC and TN significantly decreased with increasing extract concentrations, and the lowest SOC and TN were at 10 mg·mL -1 concentration, with average change of 25.4% and 22.6%, respectively ( P < 0.05).
